data.title: Nursing Home in Fort Wayne, IN
data.meta_description: Our nursing home in Fort Wayne, IN offers a variety of individualized senior care services. Contact Sage Bluff Health & Rehab to schedule a property tour.
data.text:
Since 2014, Sage Bluff Health & Rehab Center has provided quality health care and nursing services for seniors in Fort Wayne, Indiana. The senior care patients enjoy an active lifestyle with movie outings, cookouts, Saturday and Sunday night wine bars, holiday family dinners and more. Located within minutes of I-69 and U.S. Route 24, Sage Bluff Health & Rehab Center is easily accessible from anywhere in the Fort Wayne area.

Skilled Nursing Home in Fort Wayne, IN

Sage Bluff specializes in senior rehabilitation, skilled nursing and long-term care services. The community’s team of dedicated skilled nursing professionals creates specialized senior care programs and individualized care plans designed to achieve beneficial outcomes for their nursing home patients, whether they are here for short-term rehabilitation and skilled nursing services or long-term senior care. Moreover, the nursing home fosters a spirit of community in which personal interests are nurtured and lasting friendships are formed.

Sage Bluff has the compassion, experience, expertise and programs to provide the quality care that results in a high quality of life. Please give the team a call to schedule a tour of the senior rehabilitation center to see for yourself just what makes Sage Bluff Health & Rehab so special.

Short and Long-Term Senior Care in Fort Wayne, Indiana

Learn more about how these senior care services can help you or your loved one reach a higher level of wellness. Contact the staff today to have your questions answered.

If you're looking for more information about Sage Bluff Health & Rehab Center, you can connect with the team on Facebook.

"From the very beginning, the administration, managers, and staff have gone above and beyond. I have a beautiful room with a beautiful view. I was very lucky to be able to come here. Everyone, the aids, and nurses, have been so good to me and so caring." -N.Y.

This facility proudly holds an award from the American Health Care Association (AHCA) as part of the 2020 Quality Initiative Recognition Program. This recognition is for one or more of the following goals: Safely reduced long-stay and short-stay hospitalizations;​ improved long-stay or short-stay satisfaction; safely reduced the use of antipsychotic medications, or improved short-stay functional improvement or long-stay worsening mobility.
